>  Sorry for sounding cynical, but I've worked at too many corporations
>  and I've seen too many Dilbertesque PHBs complaining about the time
>  taken for testing.

After this "culture clash" (not that I haven't seen what you describe
here either but maybe to a different extent... here it is more like,
none lose their jobs and nothing else changes either) I understand the
"how to convince management" a bit better.

I think it is very true that "if you treat people like children that
is exactly how they are going to act". I can only hope that enough
companies will realise that and force the competition to do the
same...
To me it seems that there are bigger problems than not using TDD to be
solved in such organisations... darn...
/J
